lg.l: Right Trusty & so Forth, we lett you to know,
We are very ill Us'd by you Mortalls below,
For First I have often by Chymists been told,
Tho' I know Nothing on't, it is I that make Gold.
Which when you have gott, You so carefully hide it,
That since I was born, I hardly have spy'd it,
Then it must be Allow'd, Where ever I shine,
I forward the Grass & ripen the Vine,
To me the good Fellow's Apply for releif,
Without whom they can gett Neither Claret nor Beef.
Yett their Wine & their Victualls those Curmudgeon Lubbards
Lock up from my Sight in Pantrys and Cupboards,
That I have an ill Eye they wickedly think
And taint all their Meat, & Sow'r their Drink,
But thirdly and lastly it must be Allow'd,
I alone can Inspire the Poeticall Crowd,
This is gratefully own'd by each boy in the Colledge,
Whom if I inspire 'tis not to my knowledge
This every Pretender in Rhyme will Admitt
Without troubling his head About judgment or Witt.
Those Gentlemen use me with kindness and freedom,
And as for their works when I please I may read 'em,
They lie open on Purpose on Counters and Stalls,
And the Titles I view when I shine on the Walls,
But a Comrade of Yours, That Traytor Delany,
Whom I for Your Sake have Us'd better then any,
And of my Meer Motion & Speciall good Grace,
Intended in Time to Succeed in this place,
On Tuesday the tenth he Seditiously came,
With a Certain false Traytress, One Stella by Name,
To the Deanery house, & on the North Glass,
Where for fear of the Cold I never can pass,
Then & there Vi et Armis with a Certain Uttensill,
Of Value five Shillings, in English a Pencill,
Did Maliciously, Falsly, & Traytrously write
While Stella aforesaid stood by with the Light,
My Sister has lately depos'd upon Oath,
That Shee Stopp'd in her Course to look on them both,
That Stella was helping, Abetting & Aiding,
And still as he wrote stood Smiling and reading,
That her Eyes was as bright as my Self at Noon day,
But her gracefull black Locks were mingled with grey,
And by the description I certainly know,
'Tis the same Nymph I courted some ten years agoe,
Whom when I with the best of my tallents Endued,
On her promise of Yeilding, she Acted the Prude,
That some Verses were written with felonious Intent,
Direct to the North, where I never went,
That the Letters appeared revers'd on the Pane,
But in Stellas bright Eyes were plac'd right again,
Wherein she distinctly cou'd read every Line,
And presently guess'd, that the Fancy was mine,
She can swear to the Person, whom oft She has seen,
At Night between Cavan Street, & Colledge Green,
Now You See why his Verses so Seldom are Shown,
The reason is plain, they are none of his Own,
And Observe while you live, that no Man is Shy,
To discover the goods, he Comes honestly by,
If I light on a thought, he will certainly steele it,
And when he has got it finds ways to conceal it,
Of all the fine things he keeps in the Dark,
There Scarce One in Ten, but what has my mark,
And let them be seen by the World if he dare,
I'll make it appear they are all Stolen Ware,
But as for the Poem he writt on the Sash,
I think I have now gott him under my Lash,
My Sister transcrib'd it Last Night to his Sorrow,
And the Publick shall see it if I Live till to morrow,
Thr√¥ the Zodiack around, it shall quickly be spread,
In all parts of the Globe, where the Language is read,
He knows very well I n'ere gave a refusall,
When he Ask'd for my Aid, in the forms that are Usuall,
But the Secret is this, I did lately intend,
To write a few Verses, on you as my friend,
I Studied a fortnight before I could find,
As I rode in my Chariott a Thought to my mind,
And resolv'd the next Winter, for that is my Time,
When the Days are at Shortest to gett it in Rhyme,
Till then it was lock'd in my Box at Parnassus,
When then Subtile Companion, in hopes to Surpass us,
Conveys out my paper of Hints by a Trick,
For I think on my Conscience, he deals with Old Nick,
And from my Old Stock provided with Topicks,
He getts to a Window, beyond both the Tropicks,
There out of my Sight against the North Zone,
Writes down my Conceits, & Calls them his Own,
And you like a Cully the Bubble can Swallow,
Now who but Delany can write like Apollo,?
High Treason by Statute, but here you Object,
He only Stole hints, but the verse is correct,
Th√¥ the Thoughts be Apollo's 'tis finely exprest,
So a Theif steals my horse, & getts him well dress'd,
Now whereas the said Criminall seems past repentance,
We Ph≈ìbus think fitt to proceed to his Sentance,
Since Delany has dar'd like Prometheus's Sire,
To climb to our Region, and there to steal fire
We Order a Vulture in Shape of the Spleen,
To prey on his Liver and not to be seen,
And We Order Our Subjects of Every Degree,
To beleive all his Verses, were written by me,
And Under the Pain of our highest displeasure,
To call nothing His, but the Rhyme & the measure,
And Lastly for Stella just out of her Prime,
I am too much Already revenged by time.
In return to her Scorn, I send her diseases,
And will now be her friend, whenever she pleases,
And the Gifts I bestow'd her, will find her a Lover,
Th√¥ She lives till Shee's Gray as a Badger all over.
